rules.justification: Only use BEGIN..END to enclose compound statements
Function calls should have parenthesis even if they do not have any parameters
When BEGIN follows THEN, ELSE, DO, it should be on the same line, preceded by one space characte.
The END, IF, REPEAT, UNTIL, FOR, WHILE, and CASE statement should always start a line.
An IF followed by two or more ELSE IF should be replaced with a CASE.
The name of temporary variable must be prefixed with Temp.
TextConst and Label variable names should have an approved suffix.
Standard only gives notice, better error to avoid leaving garbage behind
Do not declare parameters by reference if their values are never changed.
Only find record if you need to use it.
The FindSet() or Find() methods must be used only in connection with the Next() method.
Only write actions that have an effect.
Do not use identical names for local and global variables.
The CalcDate should only be used with DataFormula variables. Alternatively the string should be enclosed using the <> symbols.
To avoid confusion, do not give local variables the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
To avoid confusion, do not give methods the same name as fields or actions in the same scope.
To avoid confusion, do not give global variables the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
Variables must be initialized before usage.
The value assigned to a variable must be used.
Avoids a runtime error from using CalcFields on a field that is not a FlowField or a field of type Blob.
You must specify a caption in the Caption property for Fields that exist on page objects.
The value of the Caption property of Fields must be filled in.
The local method must be used; otherwise removed.
StrSubstNo or string concatenation must not be used as a parameter in the Error method.
Use Get(), FindFirst() and FindLast() without Next() method.
The name of non-temporary variables must not be prefixed with Temp.
Do not use identical names for parameters and global variables.
To avoid confusion, do not give parameters the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
A Blob cannot be used as a source expression for a page field.
Actions should use the Image property.
Pages and reports should use the UsageCategory and ApplicationArea properties to be searchable.
Translations of enum value captions must not contain commas
An affix is needed.
The member ID should be within the allowed range
FlowFields should not be editable.
Do not use an Object ID for properties or variable declarations
DrillDownPageId and LookupPageId must be filled in table when table is used in list page.
The casing of variable/method usage must align with the definition.
Filter operators should not be used in SetRange.
Every object needs to specify a value for the Access property. Either true or false
Using hardcoded IDs in functions like Codeunit.Run() is not allowed.
Any table with a single field in the PK of type code or text, should have set NotBlank on the PK field.
The Caption of permissionset objects should not exceed the maximum length.
Caption is missing.
Write to FlowFields
Events in internal codeunits are not accessible to extensions and should therefore be avoided.
If Data Classification is set on the Table. Fields do not need the same classification.
If Application Area is set on the TablePage. Controls do not need the same classification.
Always provide fieldsgroups DropDown and Brick on tables.
The ID range assigned to the extension must be within the allowed range
